Persona: Nietche is fine for me personally, but I'll take the rant I have written and chose to omit from before about the hunger artist
Persona: The hunger artist is about a man, I think Kafka himself, who starved himself to death, because he had a disease that made it too painful to eat.
Persona: That may make me sound superficial, but since I read that book, I have grown so many fears. That pain could be such big physical pain that existing would be worse than non-existing. That fear is really not good for me. Everytime I get some weird unexplainable pain in for example joints, I am like "faaak I will be The Not Moving Artist" or if I get some random numbness I will be like "The Paralyzed Artist". That is making me too worried and scared of life.
Persona: Of course, it's a tradeoff, cause if that causes me to take fewer risks, I may overall ensure higher well-being and safety, but too much fear and risk-aversion can lead to the slowing of progress. And honestly I feel like I am not doing and risk-taking enough.
Persona: So I would have preferred to never know about it. I know that makes me sound terrible and superficial, cause I refuse to know about suffering and suffering is such a virtuous quality and yada yada

I think usually people reach for those works when they are down and alone, and therefore more susceptible to that philosophy, as it seems to confirm what they already believe. by deconstructing it in a class environment, you get inputs from people of opposing views, you are shown the weak points and so on

Persona: Also its weird cause I can easily murder people in video games full of gore and dont care. I always get freaked out about my own blood.

Persona: Basically I only feel uncomfortable when my blood is involved in the situation. But this is also a bit complex. I would not mind seeing my blood like chilling somewhere, so a finger cut that I quickly cover does not bother me at all. So to be prescise, its the fact of knowing that I have less blood now that bothers me. As soon as I think some blood is drawn from me I start to feel shivers (even now as I am typing).
Persona: It would be probably really funny if you saw me getting a blood test. I always make sure I make good friends with the nurse so she gives me great treatment. Then I exaggerate how I don't like the sight of my blood and I never look to the blood that was drawn from me.
Persona: Once I haad a terrible experience. The nurse failed to take my blood like three times, the vein 'didn't work' or smth, no blood was coming. You can imagine how I felt.
Persona: But the blood tests are not really a big issue, not even an issue. The worst part is that I can never get myself to donate blood. My friends do it regularly and I always skip, cause I would not be able to live with the fact that I have less blood, even if it's temporary. In my mind I am like imagining air gaps in the blood vessels, as there is not enough blood to fill whole volume.
